original: Engdahl, Sven Olof Fredrik Edvard, major, Sanden, Kinna, f. 23/3/77 i Kalmar av las :läk. Edvard E. o. Bertha Andersson. G. 06 m. Karin Håkansson. Barn: Per f. 09, Sven 15. — Stud:ex. i Kalmar 96, AIHS, KHS, SS. Und :.löjtn. v. Smål. art vrtg. 98, löjtn. 03, kapt. 13, major 27. Verkst. dir. i A-B Claes Håkansson sed. 30. Led. av kyrkorådet i Jönköp. 10-37, kyrkvärd där 21-37, led. av kyrkomötet 34 o. 36, led. av folksk :styr. i Jön-.köp. 17-24, led. av las :direkt. i Jönköp. 18-28, ordf. 28-37, led. av styr. f. Jönköp. 1. arib:förmedl. 10-18, ordf. 18-34, led. av styr. f. länsarb:ndn i Jönköp., led. av styr. f. Röda korsets Jönköp :distr. 18-34, ordf. 34-37, museiin-tend. o. riksantikv. omb. i Jönköp. 1. 28-35. RSO, RVO, RKGM.
translated: Engdahl, Sven Olof Fredrik Edvard, Major, Sanden, Kinna, born March 23, 1877 in Kalmar to physician Edvard E. and Bertha Andersson. Married in 1906 to Karin Håkansson. Children: Per (1909), Sven (1915). He passed his studentexamen (high school matriculation exam) in Kalmar in 1896 and attended the Artillery and Engineer College (AIHS), the Royal Military Academy (KHS), and Staff College (SS). He was promoted to second lieutenant in Småland’s Artillery Regiment in 1898, to lieutenant in 1903, to captain in 1913, and to major in 1927. He served as managing director of A-B Claes Håkansson since 1930. He was a member of the church council in Jönköping from 1910-37, the churchwarden from 1921-37, a member of the church assembly in 1934 and 1936, a member of the board of education in Jönköping from 1917-1924, a member of the board of directors of las:direktör and chairman from 1928-37, chairman of the board of arbetsförmedlingen (employment agency) from 1918-1934, a member of the board of the county labor union in Jönköping, a member of the board of the Red Cross in Jönköping from 1918-1934, and its chairman from 1934-1937. He served as museum superintendent and national antiquarian commissioner in Jönköping from 1928-1935. He was awarded with the Royal Order of the Sword, the Royal Victorian Order, the Royal Red Cross Medal.
